title: Business Live: Push to tame Bitcoin - BBC News
summary: france and germany push to regulate bitcoin .
emirates places $ 16bn order for a380 jets .
costa coffee reports fall in uk sales .

documents.title: good night !
text: that 's all from business live for today - thanks for reading .
we 're back on friday at 06:00 so do join us then for all the day 's business news and views .

documents.title: 2 sisters chicken supplier 'sent mps christmas biscuits '
text: mps investigating food safety breaches at chicken supplier 2 sisters food group have revealed they rejected christmas gifts sent from its boss .
the environment , food and rural affairs committee said festive packages of biscuits were sent to several members .
its chairman said the unsolicited gifts were `` inappropriate '' and they had been returned or given to local food banks .
2 sisters disputed the amount and said it was a `` goodwill gesture '' , which they send to many external stakeholders .
read more here .

documents.title: alexa fights crime
text: thought you could only use amazon 's alexa assistant to buy stuff you do n't need or listen to music ?
lancashire constabulary is here to prove you wrong : users can sign up to receive the latest news and information from the force directly to their echo smart speaker .
the free app - available from the amazon store - will provide hourly updates and also sends of wanted and missing people to the device .
the project is the brainchild of pc rob flanagan , lancashire constabulary 's innovations manager , who worked with developers from amazon .
lancashire constabulary says it is the first police force in the uk to use smart speaker technology to engage with the community .

documents.title: spotlight on spotify
text: spotify has launched a feature allowing listeners to see stories , news and other content on its platform .
the `` spotlight '' feature will include news , pop culture , sports and politics content from publishers including buzzfeed news , it said in a blog post and will be available through a play list .
spotify has filed confidentially with us regulators for an initial public offering and hopes to finalise a direct listing in the first half of the year , reuters reported last week .

documents.title: should google and facebook fund local reporting ?
text: google and facebook have been asked to help fund local journalism to cover courts and councils by tory mp john whittingdale .

speaking at a society of editors event to launch a hm courts and tribunal team dedicated to promoting press coverage of courts , the former culture secretary said it would be `` in the interests of google and facebook to support local journalism '' .
he said the venture could mirror that set up as part of the last licence fee settlement , where the bbc agreed to provide £ 8m a year to fund 150 reporters working in local newspaper newsrooms .

`` i have suggested that facebook and google could contribute into the existing scheme to support public service reporting and courts would be a very good place in which that contribution would be used to employ professional journalists . ''
however , mr whittingdale had not found the internet giants to be `` immediately enthusiastic '' in preliminary talks about his idea .

documents.title: u-turn on hiv-positive pilot
text: an hiv positive man who was told he could not train as a commercial pilot will be allowed to begin training after a u-turn by aviation officials .
the man , from glasgow , had been offered a place on an easyjet training programme .
the civil aviation authority ( caa ) has now reversed a decision not to grant him a medical certificate .
the man , who wishes to remain anonymous , said he was `` overwhelmed , shocked , elated and humbled '' .
more on the story here .

documents.title: softbank closes uber investment
text: a group of investors led by softbank has closed a deal with uber , making the japanese group the largest stakeholder in the ride-hailing firm with a 15 % stake .

the softbank-led deal includes a large purchase of shares from existing uber investors and employees at a discounted valuation of $ 48bn - about a third lower than uber 's most recent valuation of $ 68bn .
these secondary stock sales will be completed by the end of thursday on the nasdaq private market , an uber spokesman said .
the softbank investment also triggers a number of governance changes at uber , including the addition of new board members .

documents.title: macron 's single market vow
text: more on that summit between theresa may and emmanuel macron .
the french president warned that he would not allow the uk finance sector to have privileged access to the eu single market after brexit :
i have one demand and that is that the single market is preserved .
it is one of the basic principles of the european union .
now the choice in on the british side .
there can not be a differentiated access to the single market of which financial services are part . ''

documents.title: times outsells the telegraph
text: the times outsold arch rival the daily telegraph for the first time in december , according to monthly abc figures reported by campaign .
the rupert murdoch-owned daily sold an average of 446,204 copies a day between monday and saturday last month , an increase of 1.3 % , compared with a 14.2 % slide for the telegraph to 393,310 .
it is understood that the sharp slide for the telegraph is due to ending discounted or free `` bulk '' copies - a tactic still used by the times .
mr murdoch first launched a price war with the telegraph in 1993 , when the broadsheet sold a million more copies .
the times is still 20p cheaper than its rival at £ 1.60 on weekdays .
times : billions lost by taxpayer on wasteful pfi projects # tomorrowspaperstoday
no it is n't limited to the tories new labour went for it big time despite the blatantly obvious drawbacks and disadvantages
wow !
if we could only find that taxpayer , think how much money we could save !
so true
pfi expensive who 'd have fukin thought , well you live and learn it 's not as if anyone knew any better

documents.title: aldi and asda restrict energy drinks
text: asda and aldi have joined waitrose in banning the sale of high-caffeine energy drinks to children under 16 .
asda is the first of the `` big four '' supermarkets to announce an age restriction , which will apply to 84 products from 5 march 5 .
from this date customers wishing to buy these products , either in store or online , will need to be willing to show appropriate id .
aldi has also announced that customers buying soft drinks containing more than 150mg of caffeine per litre from any of its uk or ireland stores will be asked to prove their age from march 1 .
earlier this month waitrose announced a similar restriction on energy drinks from 5 march .

documents.title: may 's city hopes
text: theresa may says she believes the city of london will retain its importance after brexit .
`` i think the city of london will continue to be a major global financial centre , '' the prime minister told a joint news conference with french president emmanuel macron on a visit to the uk .
`` that is an advantage not just for the united kingdom - it 's actually good for europe and good for the global financial system . ''

documents.title: rbs anger
text: mps express anger at the treatment of bank customers by a controversial unit of # rbs & demand urgent action from ministers .
simon jones reports - and there 's much more from # todayinparliament @ twitterid at 2330
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: primark 'set to overtake next '
text: primark is set to become the uk 's second-biggest clothing retailer , overtaking next , after reporting healthy sales so far this winter - and despite not selling online .
the guardian reports that primark , which has a 6.9 % share of the clothing market by value , is set to pull ahead of next 's 7.1 % this year , according to globaldata retail analyst kate ormrod .
m & s is still the uk 's biggest clothing retailer with 8.1 % of the market .
analysts at barclays estimated that primark 's like-for-like sales rise almost 4 % over christmas - far better than the performance of m & s or next .

jason bason , finance director of parent company abf , said it would be wrong to attribute primark 's success solely to the squeeze on uk consumers ' disposable income : `` we 've got great stuff in there and we 're really good at engagement with our customers with social media and digital . ''

documents.title: carillion collapse may delay metro work
text: bosses say the multimillion-pound midland tram extension depends on other infrastructure projects .

documents.title: santander boss named in rbs scandal
text: the boss of one of the uk 's biggest banks has been named in parliament as being responsible for rbs 's scandal-hit global restructuring group ( grg ) .
nathan bostock ( who is now head of santander uk , was named by the liberal democrat leader sir vince cable .
mr bostock was one of those responsible for grg when it engaged in an intentional strategy that resulted in mistreatment of business customers , sir vince said .
santander declined to comment .
read more here .

documents.title: told you so
text: french financial regulators - including the head of the country 's central bank - got rather upset recently when a french reality tv star , nabilla benattia , encouraged her fans to invest in bitcoin .
the slump in the cryptocurrency in recent days has given them a `` told you so '' opportunity - and yes , they have seized their chance .

`` the followers of nabilla who would have invested at the time she encouraged them to would have made a very substantial loss , about a third , '' robert ophele , head of the french financial markets authority amf has said .
`` she 's the proof one should not venture recklessly into these kinds of investments , '' he added .
if you take your financial advice from someone described as the gallic kim kardashian '' , we think you probably deserve to lose your cash .

documents.title: apple 's other tax bill
text: still stateside for a moment , it seems apple is not off the hook for the $ 16bn tax it owes ireland despite saying yesterday it will fork out $ 38bn in us tax on its overseas cash pile .

`` nothing has changed , '' a spokesman for the european commission said in regard to its 2016 ruling that apple received illegal state aid in ireland through sweetheart tax deals with the government .
it ordered apple to pay ireland up to €13bn ( $ 16bn ) in august 2016 and has since taken dublin to court over its delays in recovering the money .

documents.title: fighting words ? copy that
text: carl icahn , the us activist investor with a fearsome reputation , has revived his fight with xerox .
he is calling for new leadership at the firm , which was so successful in its early days that its name became synonymous with copying .
xeros is reportedly trying to revive its fortunes through a deal with japan 's fujifilm .
mr icahn , whose firm is xerox 's largest shareholder , said his firm is open to a deal with fuji .

but he wrote in an open letter : `` one thing we are certain of , however , is that the current management team and the 'old guard ' directors are ill-equipped to negotiate a major transaction with fuji .
further , we do not believe this team is qualified to run xerox , let alone some larger combination of xerox and fuji . ''
author: Natalie Sherman
New York business reporter

documents.title: ftse falls - again
text: the ftse 100 has lost ground for a second day , falling 0.3 % to 7,700 points .
primark owner abf was the day 's biggest faller , down 3.6 % , while the top gainer was hargreaves lansdown - up 4.3 % .

documents.title: rbs to help carillion suppliers
text: rbs has joined lloyds in announcing tens of millions in funding to support small business customers affected by the collapse of carillion .
the bank will offer payment holidays and help with overdrafts to help manage any short-term cashflow challenges .
`` we have over £ 75m available and will make more finance available if required . ''
rbs is encouraging affected customers to get in touch .

documents.title: ryanair pilots get a pay rise
text: ryanair pilots have voted to accept a pay offer , giving them increases of up to 20 % .
the airline said the pay of its pilots in the uk was now a fifth higher than those at other airlines flying 737 boeing aircraft .
the increase will be paid next week after being accepted in bases including stansted - ryanair 's largest .
most ryanair pilots in ireland have already agreed to the new rates , although around a third of staff in dublin have not yet voted , which it said was `` disappointing '' .
talks with pilots ' representatives in dublin were progressing slowly , the airline said .

documents.title: push to curb bitcoin
text: france and germany will make joint proposals to regulate bitcoin at the next g20 summit in argentina in march , french finance minister bruno le maire said .
the world 's biggest and best-known cryptocurrency has fallen to half its record peak of almost $ 20,000 in recent days on fears that regulators could seek to curb speculation .
`` we have a responsibility towards our citizens to explain and reduce the risks , '' said his german counterpart peter altmaier at a joint news conference in paris .
meanwhile , the international organization of securities commissions warned that initial coin offerings ( icos ) are highly speculative .
`` there are clear risks associated with these offerings , '' it said , perhaps somewhat unsurprisingly .

documents.title: meghan wears the ( welsh ) trousers
text: meghan markle and prince harry have been visiting cardiff today .
why do we care about this on business live ?
well , the former actor wore a pair of trousers made by the hiut denim company .
the firm is based in cardigan in west wales , and was set up in 2012 a former denim factory that closed a decade earlier after 35 years , leaving 400 people unemployed .
hiut said it had been inundated with calls since ms markle 's appearance .
her trousers are thought to be the black dina skinny fit - high-waist jeans that cost £ 175 and are available to be shipped from march .
the item is expected to sell out imminently .
as it happens , my colleagues will smale and greg brosnan took a trip to cardigan late last year to visit the hiut factory - read more about it here or watch the video below :

documents.title: how do companies win government contracts ?
text: billions are spent every year on private sector contracts , but how are the decisions made ?

documents.title: steinhoff finds €60m
text: the troubled south african firm steinhoff has secured €60m ( £ 53m ) of the €200m it needs to close a funding gap and will ask its creditors to waive some imminent payments .
it owns 6,500 retail stores in 30 countries , including the uk 's poundland and furniture chains bensons and harveys .
shares in steinhoff collapsed in december after it revealed accounting irregularities that prompted the departure of top executives .
it has debts in excess of $ 20bn ( £ 15bn ) and has another meeting with its european-based financial creditors on 26 january .

documents.title: 'no talking shop ' : tuc
text: tuc general secretary frances o'grady ( has welcomed the government decision to set up a task force to deal with the collapse of carillion .
time is of the essence in dealing with this crisis .
we need urgent action to protect jobs , pay and pensions .
this can not be a talking shop , '' she said .

the tuc will press for the transfer of private sector contracts to alternative providers with jobs , pay and pensions protected , as well as a comprehensive support package for at-risk workers , apprentices and small firms .

documents.title: deutsche bahn halts trains shock
text: is the end of the world nigh ? !
deutsche bahn is suspending all long-distance trains as a storm lashed part of germany with hurricane-force winds .
trains already on the way will be halted when they reach the closest stations .

documents.title: corbyn vows to axe outsourcing
text: jeremy corbyn has said a labour government would end the outsourcing racket '' exposed by carillion 's collapse by changing procurement rules to make the public sector the first choice for delivering government services , the guardian reports .

the labour leader told the guardian : theresa may exposed the failure of the outsource-first ideology at prime minister 's questions when she said the government was 'a customer ' not 'the manager ' of carillion .
i 'm sorry , but if these are public contracts we should be the manager and not have a middleman like carillion creaming off the profits . ''

mr corbyn also used the interview to repeat his scepticism about some aspects of the single market , claiming its rules would potentially make it harder for us to tackle the outsource-first racket '' .

documents.title: amazon 's wishlist
text: amazon has put 19 us cities - and toronto - on its shortlist for its new second headquarters after receiving 238 proposals .
big cities including new york , los angeles and washington dc predictably make the list , along with smaller centres such as raleigh , north carolina , and columbus , ohio .
amazon will make a decision later in the year .
in september it announced a plan to build a $ 5bn second headquarters in north america in a move that could create up to 50,000 new jobs .

documents.title: task force to meet later
text: greg clark will chair a meeting of the task force later on thursday .

a business department spokesperson said : `` we have created a task force to continue to support and monitor the impact on small businesses and employees who have been affected by carillion 's insolvency .
the task force will meet today and will comprise representatives from business , construction trade associations , the trade unions , lenders and government . ''

documents.title: breakingcarillion task force announced
text: ministers are setting up a task force involving business and unions to support firms and workers affected by the collapse of carillion , the business department announced .

documents.title: more on morgan
text: putting aside the $ 1.2bn one-off tax charge , morgan stanley profits rose in the fourth quarter , beating analysts ' forecasts .
plus the tax payment is smaller than some of its rivals are paying .
yesterday goldman sachs announced it was paying a $ 4.4bn bill .
bank of america reported a $ 2.9bn charge , while jp morgan has a $ 2.4bn bill .
chief executive james gorman struck an upbeat note : `` we enter 2018 with strong momentum aided by rising interest rates , tax reform and an evolving regulatory framework , ''

documents.title: detriot motor show : making the future safe
text: detroit motor show : what the cars of the future may look like
pizzas inside and coffee cups on top , who is going to want to be seen dead on any thing that daft ? ? ? ? ?
all fancy and drive themselves what else is new
wooo
@ twitterid @ twitterid afternoon noted working together

documents.title: morgan stanley takes trump tax charge
text: morgan stanley 's fourth quarter profit fell by nearly 60 % after taking a $ 1.2bn charge related to new us tax laws .
the investment bank said income fell to $ 696m for the three months to 31 december , compared to $ 1.6bn in the final quarter of 2016 .
net revenue rose to $ 9.5bn from $ 9bn a year ago .

documents.title: coming up roses for airbus
text: more on that key order of airbus a380 jets by emirates .
emirates has placed a provisional order for 20 of the double-decker superjumbos , with an option for 16 more .
deliveries are due to start in 2020 .
earlier this week , airbus 's sales chief john leahy said the company would have to halt the programme if emirates , the plane 's main customer , did not place another order .
on thursday , mr leahy said : `` this new order underscores airbus ' commitment to produce the a380 at least for another ten years .
`` i 'm personally convinced more orders will follow emirates ' example and that this great aircraft will be built well into the 2030s . ''

documents.title: greening criticises heathrow plans
text: greening criticises heathrow plans

documents.title: 'so crazy it might work '
text: what to make of nintendo 's new `` labo '' set of accessories , which look like a bit like a lot of hi-tech cardboard packaging ?
it 's been a hot topic on social media and pre-orders are racing ahead .
plus nintendo 's share price took a 2.4 % bounce in tokyo .
but it 's quite a change of course for nintendo - marketing cardboard toyassembly kits at youngsters to go with the switch console , which until now was marketed to serious adult gamers .
the bbc 's north america technology correspondent says `` there are few fools at nintendo .
history tells us they know what they 're doing .
`` this latest idea is so crazy it might just work ''
you can read all about it here .

documents.title: slavery : hiding in plain sight
text: householders could `` unwittingly '' be hiring victims of modern slavery to wash their cars , paint their nails or lay their drives , councils are warning .
local councils in england and wales say they are reporting increasing numbers of potential victims of modern slavery .
here is peter 's story :

documents.title: midday market update
text: a quick check in on the ftse just before noon shows the index drifting lower again today ( after a fall on wednesday ) .
the ftse is down 30 points - or 0.39 % at 7,695.33 .
ftse 's top gainer is hargreaves lansdown up 4.1 % after barclays and others put out very positive notes on the bristol-based business .
top of the loser board is sse - down 3 % - because investors are expecting a price cap to affect revenues .

documents.title: lloyds sets up fund for carillion contractors
text: lloyds has set up a £ 50m emergency fund for small businesses affected by the collapse of carillion .
lloyds said the fund is designed `` to support small businesses within carillion 's supply chain that may now be experiencing financial difficulty '' .
the bank said business can apply for arrangement fee-free overdrafts .
the most severely impacted customers can seek capital repayment holidays on loans for an initial six month period , to help with cashflow shortages caused by the liquidation .

documents.title: bitcoin maintains gains
text: bitcoin has manged to hang onto gains and is now trading nearly 4 % higher at $ 11,585.54 .
investors have been spooked in recent days by a possible ban of the cryptocurrency in south korea and china .

documents.title: malaysian fund buys stake in battersea power station
text: a malaysian sovereign wealth fund is buying a stake in battersea power station , valuing the building made famous by pink floyd 's animals album at £ 1.6bn .
permodalan nasional berhad ( pnb ) will jointly own the building - which will be home to apple 's new uk headquarters - with employees provident fund of malaysia .
pnb is buying the stake from sime darby property and sp setia who between them own the majority of the wider 48 acre area .
pnb is a majority shareholder in sime darby property and sp setia .

documents.title: advice for carillion workers
text: citizens advice says it is ready to provide guidance on redundancy , benefits , debt and housing to carillion employees and subcontractors affected by the company 's collapse .
the fate of 400 people who worked at the company 's headquarters in wolverhampton , as well as contractors employed in the region , remains uncertain .
citizens advice is urging those affected to visit staff in wolverhampton , dudley , sandwell and walsall .

documents.title: nikkei breaks through 24,000 barrier briefly
text: japan 's benchmark nikkei 225 index temporarily broke above 24,000 points on thursday , for the first time in more than 26 years .
however the foray above the psychological barrier was short-lived , and profit taking meant the market closed down 0.4 % or 105 points at 23,763.37 .
and it was another record day in hong kong with the hang seng index hitting a fresh peak , driven by financial firms and telecom companies .
it ended the day up 138.5 points , or 0.4 % 32,121.94 .

documents.title: nationwide to take carillion jobs in-house
text: nationwide building society says it will take services previously provided by carillion in-house , saving around 250 jobs .
the firm also said that it will now deal directly with third party suppliers who employ 1,500 people to provide services such as cleaning and maintenance for nationwide .
nationwide said : `` during an unsettling time for carillion employees we felt it was important to provide them with some reassurances .
we are today announcing a proposal to bring all services provided directly by carillion in house , with carillion employees becoming nationwide employees from 22 january .
this will provide clarity for those affected and ensure that services are maintained .
as part of the wider supply chain arrangements we will also now look to deal directly with third-party suppliers that currently support the carillion contract . ''

documents.title: pfi companies like 'legal loan sharks '
text: pfi companies like 'legal loan sharks '

documents.title: finding common grounds
text: shares in whitbread , owner of costa coffee and premier inns , are up 1.58 % to £ 39.16 despite a slowdown in like-for-like sales at the coffee chain in the uk .

laith khalaf , senior analyst at hargreaves lansdown , said : `` both costa coffee and premier inn are growing , albeit through an enlarged network of outlets rather than through sales at existing locations . ''
he added : `` whitbread is also the focus of some shareholder intrigue at the moment , with the activist investor group sachem head having taken a stake in the business shortly before christmas .
`` reports suggest this hedge fund wants to push whitbread towards spinning off costa coffee .
`` the share price reacted positively to the appearance of sachem head on the shareholder register in december , which suggests the market quite likes the idea of a bit of a change .
after all , there 's not a great deal of common ground between hotels and coffee shops . ''

documents.title: emirates orders 36 more airbus a380s
text: the emirates airline has announced a $ 16bn deal to buy 36 airbus a380s .
the deal amounts to a reprieve for the plane after airbus threatened to stop making the jet if it could not come to a deal with emirates .
emirates is the only airline to have put the a380 at the heart of its operations and had been expected to place an order for more of the jets at the dubai airshow last november .
however , it then ordered 40 boeing 787 dreamliners instead .

documents.title: breakingsfo to investigate ammo-maker chemring
text: the serious fraud office ( sfo ) said it has opened an investigation into chemring group , the defence company , and its subsidiary chemring technology solutions limited ( ctsl ) .
it said it has begun a probe `` following a self-report made by ctsl '' .

`` the sfo confirms it has opened a criminal investigation into bribery , corruption and money laundering arising from the conduct of business by chemring group plc and ctsl including any officers , employees , agents and persons associated with them . ''
chemring makes ammunition and aviation countermeasures .

documents.title: me generation proves a highlight for superdrug
text: people 's preoccupation with taking of themselves proved a boon for superdrug which reported like-for-like sales up 2.4 % over christmas .
the retailer said that `` selfie generation continues to drive makeup sales '' with brow products and highlighters replacing the now rather passe contouring trend .
sales of setting spray - which fixes all that makeup in place - soared by a third in the four weeks to 30 december as `` customers emulated kim kardashian 's famous 50 step makeup routine '' .
superdrug also said online sale rose by 30 % compared to the same month last year .

documents.title: bicycle sales drive halford sales
text: demand for bicycles lifted like-for-like sales at halfords in the third quarter to 12 january .
same store sales of bikes rose by 7.8 % , helped by strong demand on black friday and over christmas .
halfords said it saw increased sales of electric bikes as well as growth in its cycle repair services .
the company also said people shopped for dash cams and there was growth in fitting services for car parts .
like-for-like sales in its autocentres business rose by 0.7 % and overall same store revenue increased by 2.7 % .
however , the company said : `` we anticipate that the uk retail sales environment will remain subdued '' for the remainder of its financial year .

documents.title: watch : stemming the domino effect
text: should there be more help for smaller firms caught up in carillion 's collapse ?
tuc tells me on @ twitterid that government should set up a national taskforce .
@ twitterid
as far as i can tell unions are only interested in what they can male for themselves anyone who can prove it different please feel free to let me know .
they should small firms have no other resources than to shut down , they provide considerable amount of jobs in community .
bigger companies have some other means or investments to fall back on
why a special case .
how many firms will go into liquidation today taking smaller firms with them .
will they get any help no they wont .
it seems that nowadays no business can survive in the `` free market '' without handouts .
having had to deal with some of the companies that carllion let contracts out to i 'm afraid i ca n't feel sorry for them bad work always late and just made a mess of anything they did

documents.title: gkn : offer 'fundamentally undervalues ' company
text: we believe gkn 's current owners should retain 100 % of the benefits of the clear upside potential in gkn , rather than handing 43 % of this upside to melrose and its shareholders .

we have already stated that the terms of melrose 's offer fundamentally undervalue the company and we are actively engaging with shareholders to explain how our transformation plan will provide value , whilst debunking some of melrose 's inaccurate assertions .

documents.title: what do you have to do to be banned as a director ?
text: more from insolvency expert julie palmer .
she was asked what someone had to do to be banned as a director or a company .
`` i would say that you probably have to be not only at the serious end in terms of misconduct but you also have to be fairly unlucky in terms of your case being taken forward .

`` so it is a very small percentage [ who are banned ] and we need a fair and transparent regime against director misconduct because otherwise it just is n't a level playing field out there for directors who are running the companies well in the face of adversity , '' she added .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: can we trust china gdp numbers ?
text: on the face of it , china 's economic growth last year was astounding .
the official figures showed gdp grew by 6.9 % from a year earlier - more than most expected .
it is also the first time since 2010 that the pace of growth has accelerated year-on-year .
however , many china watchers believe the gdp numbers are much weaker than the official figures suggest .
this month alone , the governments of inner mongolia and of the large industrial city of tianjin have admitted their economic numbers for 2016 were overstated .
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: countrywide shares plunge on warning
text: shares in countrywide , the estate agency , plunged by 17.4 % after warning that profits will tumble following `` a disappointing fourth quarter performance '' .
it said full-year profit is now expected to reach £ 672m compared to £ 737m in 2016 .
fourth quarter profit is forecast to fall to £ 164m compared to £ 179m in the same period last year .
countrywide said : `` we have begun to take a range of actions over the last quarter that we believe can restore the business back to profitable growth . ''

documents.title: subdued open for markets
text: the ftse 100 index opened down 11.71 points at 7,713.72 on thursday morning .
investment firm hargreaves lansdown is leading the risers , up 2.6 % at £ 18.89 while energy provider sse is the largest faller , down 2.3 % at £ 13.11 .
the ftse 250 is also trading lower , losing 13.41 points to 20,755.95 .
the pound is marginally ahead against the dollar at $ 1.38370 .
sterling is down 0.19 % on the euro at €1.13290 .

documents.title: are viability statements viable ?
text: under the financial reporting council 's viability test , company directors have to say the business will be a going concern for the next 12 months .
in carillion 's annual report , it said it would be okay for the next three years .
the frc 's paul george maintains that corporate governance standards in the uk are `` good '' .
`` the principal underlying the viability statement is a good one , '' he says .
`` one has to look at the application of it . ''
mr george says companies have to make a statement `` and the fact that companies do articulate that is a good thing '' .
though he concedes : `` making it more effective would be a better thing '' .

documents.title: gkn 'corrects ' melrose 's 'misleading statements '
text: engineering giant gkn yesterday rejected a £ 7.4bn hostile takeover bid from melrose industries .
turnaround specialist melrose said it believed it could `` deliver significantly greater benefits '' to gkn 's shareholders than gkn could on its own .
today gkn has put out a statement `` to correct some of the misleading statements made by melrose '' .
among other things it disputes the claim that the melrose offer represented a 32 % premium to the gkn share price at the close of trading on 5 january .
in fact , it said , the true premium was less than 11 % .
it also said that melrose had implied it could repeat its success stories it had achieved with `` substantially smaller businesses '' if it acquired gkn .
however , gkn argued that it was a `` significantly larger business than any which melrose has acquired in the past '' .
with more than five times more revenue than previous acquisitions .

documents.title: insolvency service 'needs more resources '
text: on today , presenter dominic o'connell highlighted growing calls for action to be taken against are the directors of carillion .
he asked insolvency expert julie palmer , how often directors were banned and how hard is was to get a director banned .
ms palmer said she was not making the comments in the context of carillion because the investigation is just about to start there .
however , she added : `` generally we get quite frustrated in the insolvency profession .
we see , we feel , far too few directors against whom disqualification action is taken .
`` unfortunately the insolvency service , the resources were very much cut at a a time that we felt as a profession more directors had probably taken risks on the back of a very prolonged recession

`` the resources need to be there for the insolvency service to prosecute and it seems sometimes as if a very low percentage of directors have action taken against them for what sometimes we see as examples of quite serious misconduct , '' she added .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: royal mail parcel deliveries rise
text: royal mail chief executive moya greene said the company enjoyed a `` good '' performance over christmas and handled 149 million parcels during december .
for the nine months to 24 december , parcel volumes rose by 6 % .
letters performance was `` better than expected '' , according to ms greene , with addressed letter volumes down 5 % .
overall , royal mail group revenue was up 2 % for the nine month period .
`` given our performance to date , we expect to see broadly similar volume and revenue trends in uk parcels and letters for the full year as in the nine months , '' said ms greene .

documents.title: frc assessing full investigation into carillion
text: paul george , executive director for corporate governance and reporting at the financial reporting council says that the body is making `` very active requirements '' into the issues surrounding the collapse of carillion .
he says : `` we 're liaising with the other regulatory authorities - the insolvency service and the fca .
we do have some due process before we can take a decision on whether to move it forward to a formal investigation and we will be doing that very shortly . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: costa coffee sales fall in the uk
text: the owner of costa coffee has warned that business at its high street cafes has declined and is likely to remain `` subdued '' .
like-for-like sales at costa 's high street stores fell 1.5 % in the 13 weeks to 30 november .
whitbread said : `` performance declined in traditional high street stores reflecting weakening footfall , with trading on the high street expected to remain subdued in the near term . ''
whitbread , which also owns premier inn , reported a growth in total sales of 5.6 % .

documents.title: cold weather heats up sales growth at primark
text: sales at primark rose by 7 % in the three months to 6 january , according to its owner associated british foods , despite `` unseasonably warm weather '' in october .
associated british foods says that sales growth in europe was held back by the weather but `` was followed by good trading in the five weeks leading up to christmas '' .
overall , group sales at associated british foods rose by 4 % .

documents.title: balfour beatty gets boost from us tax cut
text: balfour beatty will enjoy a boost from changes to us tax .
the infrastructure group says the tax rate on its us earnings will fall from 40 % to 26 % in 2018 and beyond .
it also said that its financials for 2017 will benefit from the revaluation of us deferred tax liabilities .
it said : `` this credit is expected to be approximately £ 20m '' .

documents.title: breakingchina beats gdp growth targets
text: china 's economy grew 6.9 % in 2017 , above a government target of 6.5 % .
the world 's second largest economy expanded at a fast pace compared to 2016 when it grew 6.8 % .

documents.title: pfi deals were 'good value '
text: in the nao report into pfi deals , it finds in some cases that some hospitals cost 70 % more than their comparator would have done .
strategist john mcternan says that `` every single pfi deal went through a treasury best value test '' and says that some were turned down .

he adds : `` i think in the very early stages of pfi both sides were learning about how to do those deals but they learned quite quickly and almost all the deals that were done from the early years onwards wre pretty good value . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: 'long queue ' of carillion creditors
text: look at the headlines today and you 'll see the government has said bosses and directors of carillion will not get bonuses or severance payments .
on the bbc 's today programme , julie palmer , an insolvency expert with begbies traynor , says it is not a surprise given that the company has gone into liquidation .
`` the incentives that they 're entitled to will now form an unsecured claim against the company , '' she says .
she pointed out that it 's a `` very long queue '' .
`` realistically the unsecured creditors should n't expect too see anything out of this process , '' she added .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: former blair strategist defends pfi
text: although the private finance initiative was introduced under john major , it was also used to fund public services during tony blair 's premiership .
john mcternan , a political strategist and mr blair 's former director of political operations , defended its use on wake up to money .
`` in 1997 when tony blair became prime minister there were still primary schools in england which had outside toilets , '' he says .
`` if we had n't used the pfi to modernise all of our schools and modernise our hospitals we 'd have had to choose between schools and hospitals and outside toilets and new a+es .

`` what happened was , rather than waiting to get things built , they were built immediately and we 've been enjoying the benefits of some of them for nearly 20 years now and that is completely ignored in this report as far as i can see in the summaries i 've seen so far . ''

documents.title: bitcoin ticks up
text: bitcoin rose a little on thursday morning , up 1.28 % according to coindesk .
however , it is trading at $ 11,283 only a few weeks after nearly touching $ 20,000 .
miton group 's gervais williams says : `` the thing about bitcoin and many of the other cryptocurrencies is just how big they are .
there 's just billions and billions and billions of pounds in these different currencies .
`` there 's about an 1,100 of these different currencies and they really are extraordinary .
so the recent cost of the sell-off we 've had in bitcoin has been over $ 30bn alone . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: rich for america
text: apple 's decision to repatriate some of its $ 252.3bn cash from outside the us could be the beginning of money flowing back into the world 's largest economy , reckons gervais williams , fund manager at miton group .
he tells wake up to money : `` it is only been held overseas because the costs of bringing it back were considered onerous under the previous taxation .

`` so by reducing taxation , more of that cash will come back and more of it will go into the economy , more of it will go into manufacturing and other products will then obviously lead to new growth in the economy . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to business live .
expect more headlines on carillion today .
in the meantime , the national audit office has this morning published a report showing that taxpayers still owe £ 199bn to private contractors under pfi deals .
it is promising to be a busy day for trading updates .
royal mail , primark-owner associated british foods , whitbread and halfords are among the plethora of companies announcing figures for the christmas period .
as always , business live would love to hear from you .
email us at bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk
